title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Madness in the desert is one hell of a documentary everyone can watch. It is a behind the scenes for Lagaan. I was moved when I saw it.
For me , it was even better than the movie itself
Beef on Netflix is overhyped show. It is just bad version of Taxi no. 9211

Paatal Lok!  Finally!  I tried it a while ago and didn't get through the first episode.  It seemed like another cops in the city show and I wasn't in the mood.  

I had nothing else to watch yesterday so I tried again.  Couldn't stop watching.  It's the first thing I've seen that I like as much as Suzhal.

Oh man, that made me go back and watch Lagaan again.  Every time they showed a bit I had to go see it in the movie.  In one week I think I did Madness 3 times and Lagaan twice.  

I also learned who Alka Yagnik and Udit Narayan are!  Now I'm totally crazy for Alka

I want to make films someday and seeing the hard-work that goes behind into working with such a large crew at such conditions is absolutely inspiring. I was in tears when they showed how that old guy wanted the shoot must go on even after going through a severe injury. 

Glad you guys liked the recommendation
